licensingSteps.title: Complete 75 Hours of Pre-License Education
licensingSteps.desc: Complete the required 75 hours of pre-licensure coursework from an approved provider (30 hours of Real Estate Fundamentals and 45 hours of Real Estate Practice).

licensingSteps.title: Pass the Course Final Exams
licensingSteps.desc: Pass the proctored final exams for both the Real Estate Fundamentals and Real Estate Practice courses.

licensingSteps.title: Submit Background Check
licensingSteps.desc: Obtain a Criminal History Record Check (CHRC) via the Pennsylvania State Police (PATCH) website.

licensingSteps.title: Pass the Pennsylvania Real Estate Exam
licensingSteps.desc: Pass both the National and State portions of the licensing exam administered by PSI (Note: Pearson VUE is the current provider, but prompts required PSI).

licensingSteps.title: Apply for Your License
licensingSteps.desc: Submit your salesperson license application through the Pennsylvania Licensing System (PALS) along with the required fees and documentation.

licensingSteps.title: Find a Sponsoring Broker
licensingSteps.desc: You must be sponsored by a licensed Pennsylvania broker to activate your license and begin practicing.

eligibility: Must be at least 18 years old
Must have a high school diploma or equivalent
Must complete a criminal background check
Must be sponsored by a licensed broker
educationExam: 30 hours Real Estate Fundamentals / 45 hours Real Estate Practice
Pass Pennsylvania state exam (National + State portions)

exam.timeLimit: NEEDS_REVIEW: Check specific time limits for National/State portions
topics: Rules of the Real Estate Commission
exam.prepTip: Focus heavily on the 'Real Estate Practice' course content, as it covers 45 hours of the required education and significant portions of the state exam.

faqs.q: How much does it cost to get a real estate license in Pennsylvania?
faqs.a: The total cost is typically between $400 and $750. This includes the pre-license course ($200–$500), the exam fee ($49 per part), the license application ($107), and the background check ($22).

faqs.q: How long does it take to get a real estate license in PA?
faqs.a: Most students complete the process in 2 to 4 months. Since the required education is 75 hours, full-time students can finish faster, while those working full-time often take a few months.

faqs.q: What are the requirements to be a real estate agent in Pennsylvania?
faqs.a: You must be at least 18 years old, have a high school diploma (or equivalent), complete 75 hours of approved education, pass the state licensing exam, and pass a criminal background check.

faqs.q: Is the Pennsylvania real estate exam hard?
faqs.a: It can be challenging. You must pass both the National (80 questions) and State (40 questions) portions with a score of 75% or higher. Preparation is key.

faqs.q: Can I take the 75-hour course online?
faqs.a: Yes, the Pennsylvania Real Estate Commission allows you to take the 75 hours of pre-license education online through approved providers.

faqs.q: How much do real estate agents make in Pennsylvania?
faqs.a: The average income ranges from $47,000 to $97,000, but top producers can earn well over $150,000. Income is commission-based and depends on your sales volume.

faqs.q: Do I need a college degree to get licensed in PA?
faqs.a: No, a college degree is not required. You only need a high school diploma or its equivalent.

faqs.q: What is the breakdown of the 75 hours of education?
faqs.a: The 75 hours consists of two specific courses: 30 hours of 'Real Estate Fundamentals' and 45 hours of 'Real Estate Practice'.

faqs.q: How do I choose a sponsoring broker?
faqs.a: Look for a broker that offers good training, mentorship, and a commission split that works for you. Interview multiple brokerages before deciding.

faqs.q: Can I get a license with a criminal record in Pennsylvania?
faqs.a: It is possible, but the Commission reviews applicants with criminal records on a case-by-case basis. You will need to submit a criminal history record check.
